address: Xã Tân An, Huyện Càng Long, Tỉnh Trà Vinh
thought:
**Navigating the Administrative Labyrinth**

Okay, so I've been given an old address: "Xã Tân An, Huyện Càng Long, Tỉnh Trà Vinh". My task is to determine the *current* administrative unit for this location.  This is a breadcrumb trail I've navigated countless times. First, the province. "Tỉnh Trà Vinh" needs to be cross-referenced against the consolidation decrees (60-NQ/TW).  Ah, yes, Trà Vinh was merged.  It's now part of "Tỉnh Vĩnh Long".

Now comes the crucial part: I have to locate "Xã Tân An" within the relevant legislative resolutions. Specifically, I'm focusing on those related to the *new* province of Vĩnh Long.  I need to meticulously scan the `Other resolutions` documents.

I've methodically worked through each resolution: 1654, 1655, 1658, 1659, 1660, 1662, 1663, 1664, 1666, and 1668.  Each one has been carefully scrutinized for any mention of "Tân An" within the context of Vĩnh Long.  I've found numerous instances of "Tân An" – in An Giang, Cà Mau, Bắc Ninh, Đà Nẵng, Đắk Lắk, Đồng Nai, Đồng Tháp, Gia Lai, Hưng Yên and Cần Thơ – but none of them are in the new province of Vĩnh Long.

This tells me that "Xã Tân An" doesn't appear to have been affected by any administrative adjustments within the context of the recent resolutions. My next step will be to search other resources.

citation.header: 1687/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Vĩnh Long
citation.line: 31. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của xã Huyền Hội và xã Tân An thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Tân An.
